title: "I was surprised by the amount of negative discussion around the mana changes personally" -Penguin
body:
Wanna know why mages are pissed about the mana changes and why Mages only afk farm the lane?

The answer is quite simple really, BECAUSE THATS ALL WE CAN DO IN THIS META.

If we try anything that resembles fighting our laner the jungler will just pop out and gank us. Their fast and healthy clears allow them to apply a lot more pressure in lanes then any other seasons.

We feel like secondary support rather than a carry because bot lane has much more influence and its better to just farm up and help support them instead of trying to be a Mid lane Carry.

Our damage is less, the enemy has more options to counter build us, more reliant on mana, and do less to objectives.

With that being said the mana changes are not bad in itself. What is bad is that you are not addressing Botlane and Junglers first but instead Mages when it should be "Fix botlane's power and Jungle pressure, then nerf mages mana" That's what everyone is pissed about. Nerfing Mana is not gonna suddenly cause assassins to be used more in competitive play, they still do not have the utility mages do to support bot lane, the only carries.

Edit: The reason why the mana band changes were more accepting is because ADCs were abusing them too, get the pattern?

Fixed the grammar a bit, the forums were doing something funky with it.

The strength of your bot lane easily translates into objective control, not mid.

Jungle clears are a lot easier and you are more healthy in the process. Go look at jungle guides/games from previous seasons and look at them now and play jungle. It used to me that unless you were a tank jungle doing blue and red without backing was unthinkable, now assassin junglers not only can do both but can come out the jungle ganking near/at full hp.

Assassins getting kills is irrelevant if you can CC and burst them down in teamfights, mages on the other hand have the ability to keep the ADC alive whille Assassins cannot. Much worse the ability to peel for the ADC has increased tremendously with how strong supports are now and how much more gold and items they can get early. You may look cool and strong early game getting a few kills as an assassin but then you start to see how useless you feel in teamfights where Mages have the advantage in.
If they are surprised, maybe they should actually pay attention? I dont even like to play mages and I saw this coming as soon as I glanced at the notes.

They eventually see the problem after it being literally and figuratively yelled at them, but then they have no clue how to fix the problem and fix...something, that just ends up creating a completely different problem while not even addressing the initial problem. I'm not on the "balance team are morons" train, but it is clear there is a massive disconnect between what they see and what is actually there and it is confusing at times what they are looking at.

It is like a window won't open so they break it with a hammer then go "I'm not sure why people are reacting so negatively to our solution".

ADC changes are coming in patch 8.10. Changes to mages in 8.9 are in preparation for that. 

If you nerf ADCs and make them less able to kill squishies, then mages become super dominant. Ensuring that mages can easily run out of mana late game helps with that, that way you don't have to actually kill a mage to remove them from the fight, they can do it themselves if they screw up and burn too much mana on missed/fishing skills. 

The order is only because of the level of changes. Mages are getting changes to a few items and to their stats, so it goes in the smaller patch. ADCs are getting changes to their entire build path and structure, as well as to their core IE mechanic. So it goes in the bigger patch, which just happens to be later. It's not some conspiracy to make mage players suffer for two weeks, you know.
